content:
2 December 2005
Customer Relationship Management 
(CRM)  & 
Supply Chain Management (SCM)
Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh
Faculty of Engineering & IT –Israa University, Gaza
Chief Technology Officer  (CTO) –NomadRem UAB, Vilnius, Lithuania
https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr -ahmed -tayeh/Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 2
Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 3
What is CRM?
▪Primary goal: Maximize customer lifetime value (CLV)
through organized interactions
▪Centralizes all customer data in one platform (contacts, 
purchases, service history)
▪Key users: Sales, marketing, and customer service teams
▪Critical for: Customer retention , cross -selling, and 
personalized experiences
▪Replaces: Disorganized spreadsheets and siloed department 
databases
▪Integrates with: ERP, e-commerce, social media, and call 
centersAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 4
What is CRM?...
▪Measures success via: Retention rates , CLV, and customer 
satisfaction scores
▪Industry examples:
▪Retail: Personalized recommendations
▪Banking: 360°client views
"CRM is the central nervous system of customer -centric    
businesses."Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 5
Evolution of CRM Systems
▪1980 s:Basic contact databases (digital Rolodexes)
▪1990 s:Sales Force Automation (SFA) emerges (e.g., Siebel 
Systems)
▪2000 s:Cloud CRM revolution (Salesforce launches in 1999 )
▪2010 s:Social CRM integrates Twitter/FB for service
▪2015–2020 :Mobile CRM dominates (apps for field teams)
▪2020 s:AI-powered CRM with:
▪Predictive analytics
▪Chatbots (e.g., ChatGPT for service)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 6
Evolution of CRM Systems …
▪Current trends:
▪Voice -enabled CRM (e.g., "Hey Salesforce, show my top leads")
▪Hyper -personalization using AI
▪Key driver: Shift from transactional to relationship -based
marketing
▪Future: Augmented Reality (AR) CRM for product demos
▪91% of businesses with 10+ employees now use CRM (Grand 
View Research)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 7
CRM & Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
▪CLV is the Total revenue a customer generates over their 
relationship
▪CRM tools for CLV:
▪Purchase history tracking
▪Churn prediction algorithms
▪Identifies most profitable customer segments
▪Enables:
▪Targeted retention campaigns
▪Loyalty programs (e.g., Starbucks Rewards)
▪Reduces churn via proactive service alerts
▪Case study: Amazon ’s recommendation engine increases CLV 
by 30%+Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 8
CRM & Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) …
▪Key metrics:
▪Repeat purchase rate
▪Average order value growth
▪Integration: CLV models feed into marketing automation
▪Warning: Poor data quality distorts CLV calculations
▪Increasing retention by 5% boosts profits 25–95%(Harvard 
Business Review)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 9
Operational CRM (Sales Focus)
▪Automates repetitive sales tasks :
▪Lead assignment
▪Follow -up reminders
▪Standardizes sales processes across teams
▪Key features:
▪Opportunity tracking
▪Quote/proposal generation
▪Territory management for field teams
▪Mobile access for on -the-go updates
▪Integrates with email/calendar (e.g., Outlook sync)
▪Example: Salesforce Sales Cloud workflowsAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 10
Operational CRM (Sales Focus) …
▪Benefit: 28% faster sales cycles (Aberdeen Group)
▪Risk: Over -automation can hurt relationships
▪Sales reps using CRM see 41% higher quotas (CSO Insights)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 11
Analytical CRM (Data -Driven Insights)
▪Processes customer data to uncover patterns
▪Segments customers by:
▪Demographics (age, location)
▪Behavior (purchase frequency)
▪Value (profitability tiers)
▪Predictive analytics for:
▪Churn risk scoring
▪Next -best -product recommendations
▪Campaign performance measurement
▪Tools:
▪Einstein Analytics (Salesforce)
▪Dynamics 365 Customer InsightsAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 12
Analytical CRM (Data -Driven Insights) …
▪Case: Starbucks uses 90+ customer segments
▪Data sources: Combines internal + external (social, market 
data)
▪Outputs: Interactive dashboards , automated alerts
▪Challenge: Requires clean, unified data
▪Companies using analytics see 73% higher sales (Forrester)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 13
Collaborative CRM (Partner Ecosystems)
▪Connects vendors, distributors, and partners
▪Shared access to:
▪Inventory levels
▪Joint lead info
▪Self-service portals reduce email chaos
▪Co-marketing campaign management
▪Example: SAP PartnerEdge portal
▪Features:
▪Document sharing
▪Commission tracking
▪Benefit: 40% faster partner onboardingAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 14
Collaborative CRM (Partner Ecosystems) …
▪Integration: Works with PRM systems
▪Security: Role -based access is critical
▪Trend: Blockchain for shared transaction ledgersAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 15
AI in CRM (ChatGPT for Service)
▪Chatbots handle routine inquiries ( 24/7)
▪Sentiment analysis flags frustrated customers
▪Automated case routing to correct department
▪Self-service knowledge bases with AI search
▪Predictive service: Alerts before issues arise
▪Voice assistants guide field technicians
▪Example: Zendesk ’s Answer Bot
▪Benefit: 70% faster resolution times
▪Implementation: Needs historical ticket data
▪Future: Emotion detection via voice toneAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 16
CRM Vendors
▪Salesforce
▪Market leader (19.8 % share in 2023 )
▪Best for: Enterprise sales & marketing teams
▪Flagship product: Sales Cloud + Einstein AI
▪Pricing: $$$ (Starts at $ 25/user/month)
▪HubSpot
▪SMB favorite (All-in-one CRM + marketing)
▪Strengths: User -friendly , free tier available
▪Key tool: Marketing Hub workflows
▪Pricing: $$ (Free to $ 1,200 +/month)
▪Microsoft Dynamics 365
▪Deep Office 365 integration
▪Best for: Companies using Teams/Outlook
▪AI feature: Copilot for sales insightsAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 17
CRM Vendors …
▪SAP CRM
▪ERP integration powerhouse
▪Used by: Manufacturers, global enterprises
▪Edge: Hybrid (cloud + on -premise) deployment
▪Zoho CRM
▪Budget -friendly for startups
▪Unique feature: Blueprints (visual workflows)
▪Key Selection Criteria:
▪Scalability (Can it grow with your business?)
▪Mobile access (Field sales needs?)
▪AI capabilities (Predictive analytics?)
▪Cloud vs. On -Premise:
▪Salesforce: Cloud -only
▪SAP: Offers bothAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 18
CRM Vendors …
▪Industry Specialization:
▪Retail: Salesforce Commerce Cloud
▪Healthcare: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Healthcare
▪Implementation Time:
▪Basic setups: 2-4 weeks (HubSpot)
▪Enterprise: 6-12 months (SAP)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 19
Case Study: Salesforce @Starbucks
▪Challenge:
▪25M+ customers needing unique experiences
▪Siloed data across apps/regions
▪Solution: Salesforce Customer 360
▪Unified mobile app, POS, and rewards data
▪Key Tools Used:
▪Marketing Cloud (Personalized emails)
▪Einstein AI (Predictive ordering)
▪Personalization Examples:
▪"Happy Birthday" free drink coupons
▪Weather -based recommendations (e.g., iced vs. hot drinks)
▪Replenishment alerts for favorite itemsAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 20
Case Study: Salesforce @Starbucks …
▪Results:
▪23% increase in spend by rewards members
▪2.5X more app engagement vs. industry average
▪Data Points Collected:
▪Purchase history
▪Location patterns
▪Customization preferences (e.g., almond milk)
▪Integration:
▪ERP (SAP) for inventory
▪Payment systems for seamless checkout
▪Starbucks processes 17M+ personalized transactions/week
▪Lesson: Hyper -personalization drives loyaltyAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 21
Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 22
Supply Chain Management
▪SCM: Coordination of goods, data, and finances across the 
supply chain.
▪Core Goal: Deliver products faster, cheaper, and more 
sustainably .
▪Key Players:
▪Suppliers (Raw materials)
▪Manufacturers (Production)
▪Logistics (Transport)
▪Retailers/Distributors
▪Digital SCM: Uses IoT, AI, and blockchain for real -time 
tracking.Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 23
Supply Chain Management …
▪Traditional vs. Modern SCM:
▪1980 s:Linear, manual processes
▪2020 s:Dynamic, AI -driven networks
▪Key Metrics:
▪Order -to-delivery time
▪Inventory turnover ratio
▪Tech Stack:
▪ERP (SAP, Oracle)
▪Warehouse Management Systems (WMS)
▪Trends:
▪3D printing (Localized production)
▪Drone deliveries (Last -mile solutions)
▪79% of companies compete via SCM efficiency (Deloitte).Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 24
SCM Components –Planning & Sourcing
▪Demand Planning:
▪AI forecasting (e.g., Walmart ’s weather -based models).
▪Inventory Optimization:
▪Safety stock calculations to prevent stockouts.
▪Supplier Selection Criteria:
▪Cost
▪Quality
▪Geopolitical risk
▪Procurement Tools:
▪SAP Ariba (Supplier networks)
▪Coupa (Spend management)Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 25
SCM Components –Planning & Sourcing …
▪E-procurement Benefits:
▪30% faster purchase orders
▪Audit trails for compliance
▪Case Study:
▪Apple’s supplier diversification post -COVID.
▪Risk Mitigation:
▪Multi -sourcing (No single -supplier dependency).
▪Sustainability Focus:
▪Ethical sourcing (e.g., conflict -free minerals).
▪Tech Integration:
▪Blockchain for supplier transparency.Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 26
SCM Manufacturing & Delivery Processes
▪Lean Manufacturing:
▪Just-in-Time (JIT) (Toyota ’s model).
▪Production Scheduling:
▪Digital twins simulate factory workflows.
▪Quality Control:
▪Computer vision for defect detection.
▪Warehouse Automation:
▪Amazon’s Kiva robots (50% faster picking).
▪Last-Mile Delivery Solutions:
▪Route optimization algorithms .
▪Crowdsourced delivery (Uber Freight).Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 27
SCM Manufacturing & Delivery Processes …
▪Real -Time Tracking:
▪GPS/ RFID for shipment visibility.
▪Returns Management:
▪Reverse logistics for refurbishment.
▪Case Study:
▪Zara’s 2-week design -to-store cycle .
▪Automation cuts warehouse costs by 40%(McKinsey).
▪Future Trend: Autonomous delivery vehicles .Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 28
SCM Technologies (IoT, AI, Blockchain)
▪IoT in SCM:
▪Temperature sensors for perishable goods.
▪Equipment health monitoring .
▪AI Applications:
▪Demand forecasting (Tools: ToolsGroup , Kinaxis ).
▪Chatbots for supplier queries .
▪Blockchain Benefits:
▪Tamper -proof records (e.g., diamond sourcing).
▪Smart contracts for automatic payments.
▪Cloud SCM:
▪Oracle SCM Cloud
▪Infor Nexus (Multi -enterprise platform).Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 29
SCM Technologies (IoT, AI, Blockchain) …
▪Digital Twins:
▪Simulate supply chain disruptions.
▪Robotic Process Automation (RPA):
▪Automates purchase order processing .
▪Case Study:
▪Maersk’s blockchain -based TradeLens .
▪AI reduces forecasting errors by 30–50%(BCG).
▪Challenge: Integration complexity with legacy systems.
▪Future: 5G-enabled real -time tracking .Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 30
SCM Vendors: SAP SCM
▪Applications:
▪Manufacturing execution
▪Advanced planning (SAP IBP)
▪Warehouse management
▪Key Features:
▪Real -time analytics integrated with SAP ERP
▪AI-driven demand forecasting
▪Blockchain for supply chain transparencyAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 31
SCM Vendors: Oracle SCM
▪Applications:
▪Retail supply chains
▪Global logistics
▪Procurement
▪Key Features:
▪Digital twin technology for scenario modeling
▪Autonomous logistics (IoT + AI)
▪End-to-end order fulfillment trackingAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 32
SCM Vendors: Infor SCM
▪Applications:
▪Food & beverage industry
▪Healthcare supply chains
▪Asset -intensive industries
▪Key Features:
▪Industry -specific preconfigured solutions
▪Multi -enterprise collaboration portals
▪Predictive inventory optimizationAsst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 33
Amazon SCM Case Study
▪Challenge: Handle 11,000 orders/second on Prime Day.
▪Solution:
▪AI-powered demand forecasting .
▪Kiva robots in warehouses.
▪Inventory Strategy:
▪Dynamic placement based on demand.
▪Last-Mile Innovation:
▪Amazon Flex (Crowdsourced drivers).
▪Result:
▪98% on -time delivery .
▪20% lower logistics costs .Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 34
CRM & CSM Integration: Powering Business Success
▪Real -World Impact:
▪Companies with integrated CRM -SCM systems see 27% higher profit 
margins (Aberdeen Group).
▪Data Flow Example:
▪CRM detects rising demand for Product X → SCM triggers production 
increase.
▪Demand Forecasting:
▪CRM sales data feeds SCM algorithms to predict inventory needs 
(e.g., Nike’s seasonal demand models ).
▪Order Promising:
▪SCM provides real-time inventory status → CRM shows accurate 
delivery dates to customers.Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 35
CRM & CSM Integration: Powering Business Success …
▪Personalized Logistics:
▪CRM preferences (e.g., "eco -friendly shipping") → SCM selects low-
carbon carriers .
▪Unified Platforms:
▪SAP C/ 4HANA (CRM) + IBP (SCM) share data seamlessly.
▪AI Orchestration:
▪Chatbots (CRM) check order status by pulling SCM logistics data.
▪Case in Action: Amazon
▪Prime Membership (CRM):
▪Tracks customer preferences → Fulfillment Centers (SCM): Pre-
position bestsellers near buyers.Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 36
CRM & CSM Integration: Powering Business Success …
▪Result:
▪Same -day delivery for 65% of Prime users.
▪Implementation Tips
▪Start Small:
▪First integrate order status visibility between systems.
▪Data Hygiene:
▪Standardize SKUs/customer IDs across CRM & SCM.
▪Change Management:
▪Train sales teams to use SCM data when promising deadlines.Asst. Prof. Dr.Ahmed A.O. Tayeh 37
Thank You!

content: The Islamic University of Gaza Faculty of Information Technology Cloud and Distributed Systems (SICT 4313)  Developing a Cloud-Based Program for Basic Data Analytics  You are required to develop a cloud-based program/service for searching, sorting and classifying a large collection of documents. - You need to collect a large number of pdf and word documents. Store them into the cloud either manually or through the interface you develop in your program. You may also use any web scrapping tool to collect them directly from their sources on the web. This collection can be updated any time through any of these options. - Write a function within the program to sort these documents based on their titles (the title, not the name of the file, should be extracted from the document). - Write a second function within the program to search these documents for a certain text (combination of keywords). The output must be documents that satisfy the search criteria. When opening these output documents, the search text found inside them must be highlighted. - Write a third function to classify these documents based on a predefined classification tree and using the classification algorithm of your choice. - The program should provide information and statistics such as the size and number of documents stored, the time it took to search, sort, and classify these documents. Note: - You can use any programming language. - You can use one or more cloud platforms of your choice at the same time. - Upload, your source code of the project to GitHub repository. The source code should be well documented so anyone can read, understand and follow it. - You need to write a report (use the attached template) describing, explaining, and discussing your selected algorithms, your development as well as the platform and how you used it. Adapt a cloud development approach. Include also the link to the program on the cloud and how to use it. Include also the link to the GitHub repository of the program. - You can work as individual or in a group (Maximum no. of members in the group is 3)  Best wishes  Dr. Rebhi S. Baraka
